Results.Heading: Senior Back-End Developer
Results.Descr:
We are looking for a Senior Back-End Developer (B2B online)

DNA is recognized as an excellent employer. We are sure that you will enjoy working for us. Below, you can find reasons why you should choose us for the next stage of your career!

EMPLOYMENT DETAILS: 
Role: Senior Back-End Developer
Start date: As soon as possible
Employment: permanent
Location: Helsinki & flexible remote work in Finland
Application period ends: 18.9.2022
For further information, please contact: Joni Nyqvist, p. +358440442752 / joni.nyqvist(at)dna.fi


We at DNA aim to use the most cutting-edge technology to deliver high quality online services for both our consumer and business customers. Our online teams are responsible for developing DNAs web shop, self-service portals, websites and mobile applications. In the development we use both our internal developers and selected vendors to create the best customer experience as possible. To do so, we use a Headless CMS and microservice architecture on top of cloud services, supported by high end e-commerce and CMS platforms. 

We are looking for a Back-End Developer to be part of our B2B online development team. The person we are looking for is a strong team player who knows how to deliver high quality code and is interested in learning new technologies. We expect you to be fluent in English and have experience in agile working methodologies (Scrum, SAFe, Kanban) and DevOps (CI/CD). Some knowledge of Finnish language is considered a bonus but is not mandatory as we work with multicultural teams using mostly English as the working language.

We expect you to have software development experience and excellent coding skills with Java technologies. We use a lot of integrations so we expect that you are experienced in both using and implementing them (REST-APIs, microservices). Experience in e-commerce, telecommunications industry, SAP Commerce Cloud or microservice architecture is also considered a bonus. 

Our head office is in Helsinki and we have offices in most of the bigger cities in Finland like Turku, Tampere, Lahti, Oulu, Jyväskylä, Pori, Rauma. However you will be able to work remotely within Finland if you so choose. We offer you:
A chance to participate in different exciting projects and develop your skills as a software professional
Friendly and easy-going co-workers and work environment
Possibility to professional growth based on your own interests
Possibility to effect how the things are done
Nice and recently renovated office spaces at all our locations
Possibility to work remotely
Good benefits


You can submit your application in Finnish or English.

If you have a public github repository or other ways to show case your earlier work, please include a link in your application.

REASONS FOR CHOOSING DNA: 

DNA strives to provide an excellent place to work, and we are constantly aiming to improve our practices as an employer to meet this goal. We want to appreciate all our employees as they are - as one-of-kind. No matter their age, gender, look, where they come from, who they love, or how you see the world. Being one-of-a-kind is our richness. Click the links below to find out more about things that may be of interest to you. 
Employee Benefits
Learning & Career Development
Work Culture
Family-friendly Workplace
Diversity
Corporate Responsibility
Finance
Internationality


DNA IN A NUTSHELL: 

DNA is one of the leading telecommunications companies in Finland. We want to make our customers' daily lives less complicated. We offer connections, services and devices for homes and workplaces, contributing to the digitalisation of society. DNA's customers are continuously among the world mobile data usage leaders. DNA has about 3.6 million subscriptions in its fixed and mobile communications networks. The company has been awarded numerous times as an excellent employer and family-friendly workplace. In 2021, our total revenue was EUR 956 million and we employ about 1,600 people around Finland. DNA is a part of Telenor Group, a leading telecommunications company across the Nordics. More information: www.dna.fi, Twitter @DNA_fi, Facebook @DNA.fi and LinkedIn @DNA-Oyj.

Results.Heading: Senior Frontend Developer - Oikotie Asunnot
Results.Descr:
THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL

You? Experience in frontend development, writing testable code and developing web platforms. Growth & curious mindset, eagerness to take part in product discovery.
Role? Seasoned frontend developer contributing to the future of Oikotie Asunnot, one of the leading user-based real estate websites in Finland with over a million weekly users: designing and implementing scalable and robust web services, optimised for search engines with accessibility standards in mind, great care for UX and with neat UI. 
Tech stack? Ecmascript/Typescript, Git, AngularJS (now transitioning to Angular), SEO. Environments run in AWS and CI/CD pipelines are used to automate builds, run tests and make deployments.
Location? We work in a hybrid way, so you can be based anywhere in Finland! Our team is currently spread between Helsinki and Turku. If you like, our office is there for you just a few steps away from the Helsinki railway station.
Why us? Routine is not for you and you're more into a variety of tasks? With us, there's no day alike and your playground is tailorable to your ambitions! Developers are highly valued in our teams and are encouraged to pitch in with ideas on how to push the service forward. And talking about the future, we're on our way towards a deepened collaboration with the other Nordic Schibsted countries, which translates into even more opportunities for both technical and personal development! Our benefits include among others an extra week of holiday, recreational and lunch benefits on top of your salary, and flexible working hours and spots! 

Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!

WHO ARE YOU?
Experience working on web services and frontend development with TypeScript and Javascript-based frameworks like Angular or AngularJS.
Experience with consuming APIs.
Experience with improving website ranking for SEO.
Proficiency with Git is a big plus.
Fluency in English (even on Monday mornings;-). Our official language is English and we gather people together from multiple backgrounds (memes in Spanish, Indian cooking recipes, database parodies, and dog videos circulate on our Slack channels!).
As a person , you're a curious self-starter team player with a problem-solving mindset who shares our passion to constantly develop ourselves. If passion for what you do and trust among your team are values that resonate with you, we believe that our working culture is a great fit for you!

WHAT'S THE JOB LIKE?

Day-to-day work & Projects
As our Senior Frontend Developer, you are part of our diverse Oikotie Asunnot tech team. With the mission to serve our customers to make smart choices in our marketplace, we deliver a first-class product thanks to dedicated teams both for web and mobile applications. Your main focus is on developing new features in the marketplace along with modernising the platform's architecture. Over 70% of our users use the website on mobile, so knowing the best practices for development for both desktop and mobile users is essential. 

Furthermore, you technically design and implement scalable and robust solutions in a high-load environment, and you know your way around how to organise the frontend code in a sustainable & maintainable way in large-scale projects. The users are in the centre of whatever we do, thus identifying trends and championing best practices are also on your desk. We value our users' experience and also like keeping our conversions high, so you will be finding these sweet spots through A/B testing and prototyping. Don't forget about keeping up and implementing new features to improve SEO, to further improve our organic search rankings. 

Hadn't got a chance to get your hands dirty with something from the list above? Don't worry, you will learn by working with us! Giving trust and feeling trusted in our work and skills are core values to us. While we take ownership of applications and products, we never forget that it is by trusting each other and learning together that we are able to be the most efficient real estate marketplace in Finland. This is how we are able to drive +1 million users to our services every week, and here is where you can leave your mark. 

Not everything is sweet, so here's the main opportunity to improve
As we are scaling up our software architecture and collaborating across teams, we aim to modernise the architecture and make it more loosely coupled. We are currently transitioning from AngularJS to Angular. Thus, your expertise is needed in analysing the current situation and throwing in ideas. Are you ready to hop along on the development journey? 

Goals

During your first few months, we expect you to get on board, settle in the team, gradually take over your role and collaboratively start maintaining and building new features for the Oikotie Asunnot front end. 

Further down the road, approximately after 6 months, we're eager to see you standing on your own (we're here to have your back!). You finish backlog tasks & also contribute to building our vision, strategy and work methods. For example, your expertise is needed in product discovery initiatives where you would act as a tech expert. How do we bring even more traffic and new listings to our real-estate platform, it's up to you and to the team!

Colleagues

Here is a 98-member tech family eagerly waiting for you! Our Oikotie Asunnot Tech team gathers together 15 bright experts: developers, QA, designers, Product Managers & a Development Manager. There is a lot of experience within the squad and we're always ready to share our knowledge and polish our skills. We are mature in agile practises and our work is paced by two-week sprints and OKRs (Objectives, Key Results) in a network of empowered cross-functional squads. 

How do we collaborate? We want to win it together, thus we plan and prioritise together, discuss and decide technical details and then focus on implementation. Everyone works both independently and as a part of the team, so you can count on us to receive help and also support others when needed. When it comes to aspects outside of our expertise such as design, analytics, or marketing, there're specialists available in cross-functional teams to give a helping hand. 

Company

Schibsted, product company, gathering together Oikotie, Tori, & Rakentaja reaching +4M users monthly. Over 250 colleagues in Finland and 5500 in the Nordics want to steer innovation on News media, Marketplaces & Growth adventures to empower the millions of people interacting with us in their daily lives. We're lucky to work with colleagues who share the passion for their work, are friendly and caring. Our community embraces curiosity, teamwork, a problem-solving mindset, and continuous learning. Have a sneak peek at our boogie on LinkedIn & Instagram and get to know the Schibsted Tech & Shetech Communities along with the Schibsted Talks podcast hosted by our very own colleagues. 

GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!
If you are looking for a workplace and the role in which you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and feel good, let us hear from you! We're eagerly waiting for you to turn yourself in by Sunday, September 11.

ANY QUESTIONS?
Our Development Manager (Oikotie Asunnot) Yevgeniya Nattila (yevgeniya.nattila(at)schibsted.com, or by phone on Wednesdays from 9-10 at +358468108645 ) is happy to tell you more about the daily work and she and Alessia Porazzi , Talent Acquisition Specialist, (alessia.porazzi(at)schibsted.com) can share insights about our company culture! 

RECRUITMENT PROCESS?
1. 60 min meeting with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Alessia (your background & skills, career goals and Schibsted as an employer)
2. 45 min chat with the Development Manager, Yevgeniya (diving deeper into your background & skills, role goals & expectations)
3. 75 min technical interview with a few developer colleagues and our Head of Engineer Manager, Juha (get to know each other, how would it be to work as part of the team, diving deeper into your skillset)

Get your questions ready for us!
During every interview, we aim to create a space for open and genuine communication from both sides. So think about things you would like to know from us and have courage to ask difficult questions too! The recruitment decision always has 2 sides: it's our decision, but most importantly, it's your decision who you trust with your growth & career. This way, we want to make sure that all your questions are answered and that you have the best possible tools to make a decision for your future. #LI-AP1

Schibsted Finland doesn't accept unsolicited profiles from recruitment agencies and won't pay fees to any third-party agency or company that doesn't have a signed agreement with us. If provided, we're free to contact the profiles ourselves.

Your responsibilities in this particular role include:

 * Development and enhancement of the back end and API's for the platform.
 * Working with the rest of the team to ensure the Client delivers a market leading product.
 * Full lifecycle development - from design to implementation, testing, deployment and maintenance.
 * Co-operation and co-ordination with their other teams to leverage their internal architecture and messaging backbone.

Requirements:

 * 5+ years of professional software development experience
 * Strong experience in C# & .NET Core on the backend
 * Experience with Azure technologies such as Azure Functions, Azure Queues and Azure Event Hubs is a plus, but a strong desire to work with these technologie is key
 * Fluency in English is mandatory, any Scandinavian language is a big plus
 * Experience working with Continuous Integration tools (JIRA, Confluence, Bamboo, Octopus, Application Insight) and / or Containers (Docker / Kubernetes) is a huge plus

Benefits:

* Strong Salary & Compensation Package
 * Company health care (extended compared to many companies)
 * Lunch benefit (in-house lunch and/or lunch coupons)
 * Sport vouchers to a maximum of EUR 400 per year
 * Mobile phone
 * Home internet
 * Travel insurance (also covering private travel)
 * Free access to gym (24/7) at the company premises
 * Training possibilities (e.g. access to Pluralsight)
 * Talent Management - access to conferences etc.
 * Good IT equipment (electric desks, double screens etc.)
 * Fresh fruit at the office
 * Free coffee and tea
 * Massage chair
 * Company events
 * Flexible working hours - possibility to work remotely (to be agreed with team lead)
 * Yearly salary reviews

Those interested should send their CV and contact details to the address below, we shall be in touch shortly.

Email Address: b.green@frankgroup.com

Telephone Number: +358 9 4245 1427

Results.Heading: Ohjelmistorobotiikan kehittäjiä
Results.Descr:
Tekoja ja sujuvuutta alansa huipuille! Haluatko sinä olla mukana?

Haemme Certiaan
OHJELMISTOROBOTIIKAN KEHITTÄJIÄ


Certian järjestelmäautomaatiotiimi tukee asiakkaidemme sekä Certian sisäisiä prosesseja mm. ohjelmistorobotiikan, sähköisten lomakkeiden ja tekoälyratkaisujen avulla. Tukenamme on lisäksi vahva kumppaniverkosto täydentämässä omaa osaamistamme. Ohjelmistorobotiikan kehityksessä käytämme UiPath tuotteita.

Mitä ohjelmistorobotiikan kehittäjän työnkuvaan kuuluu?


Ohjelmistorobotiikan kehittäjänä pääset toteuttamaan uusia ratkaisuja, sekä ylläpitämään ja kehittämään jo tehtyjä automaatiota. Olet osana mukavaa tiimiä, jossa rooliasi voidaan jossain määrin muokata taustasi ja kiinnostuksen kohteittesi mukaisesti. Olet kiinnostunut ratkaisemaan haasteita nykyaikaisilla tietoteknisillä ratkaisuilla ja kykenet omaksumaan asiakkaidemme prosesseja riittävissä määrin jotta osaat soveltaa ratkaisut käytäntöön. 

Millainen henkilö onnistuu tässä työssä?


Työssä edellytetään hyviä vuorovaikutustaitoja, itseohjautuvuutta ja oma-aloitteisuutta. Työ on monipuolista ja päivät ovat harvoin samanlaisia, joten myös oman työn ohjaamisen hallintataidot ovat tärkeitä. Työssä käytettävät välineet ovat helpompi omaksua, mikäli sinulla on koulutusta tai kokemusta ohjelmistokehittämisestä. Työssä menestymiseen saat meiltä perehdytystä ja koulutusta.

Miksi Certia on houkutteleva työpaikka?

Työntekijöidemme pysyvyys on korkealla ja meillä monella on jo työhistoriaa Certiassa yli 10 vuotta. Meillä on joustava etätyömahdollisuus ja erittäin hyvät edut tyky-seteleistä työterveyshuoltoon.
Toimi heti ja lähetä hakemuksesi osoitteeseen info@certia.fi 30.09.2022 mennessä! 


Haluatko kysyä lisää? 


Ota yhteyttä Toni Moilaseen:   toni.moilanen@certia.fi, +358400816189


Millainen työantaja Certia on? Lue lisää Certiasta työnantajana täältä: 
https://www.certia.fi/toihin-meille/

Mitä työntekijämme kertovat Certiasta? Tutustu uratarinoihimme täällä:
https://www.certia.fi/kategoria/uratarinat/

Results.Heading: Software Developer
Results.Descr:
We are seeking skilled and experienced Developers with a passion for software excellence to join our fun-loving bunch in Finland.
 
 We are known for doing coding-related computing stuff. In other words, most of us work with different web, mobile (Android/iOs), IoT, or product-based solutions. Our main front-end technologies are React, Angular and Vue, and back-end technologies Java/Kotlin, Node.js, C#/.NET, Clojure and Python/Django. For IoT, we mainly use Python and C/C++. Hence, we hope that you master at least one of these on a senior-level. Moreover, we mostly work with - but are not limited to - cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP and Azure.
 
 Our customer base and the scope of our projects are wide, from small start-ups to globally large enterprises, and from legacy-type maintenance to hipster-friendly AR/VR projects. So, due to our ever-developing working environment, you don't need to worry about getting stuck or bored. Take a peek at our Customers to see what we're talking about. We are also always working on dozens of *hush hush* projects.
 
 Our way of working and thinking usually suits those who are, or want to be, at the top of their profession. Work with us, and you get to be part of our Vincit community which consists of the country's top developers, designers, and other experts.
 
Why Vincit?
 
Continuous development, agility, and individual freedom have always been essential for us. At Vincit, you get to lead yourself, design your own role, shake up the stuffy traditions of working life, and work in a modern environment that helps people reach their dreams.
 
You are able to work remotely if that's your thing, and we also offer fascinating opportunities to work at our global offices - just let us know about your interests and we'll tell you more.
 
Click here to learn about the tons of other reasons why Vincit may be a great home away from home for you and how we make sure that our daily work is not just about going through the motions.
 
 Vincit has been awarded as the Best Workplace in Europe by the Great Place to Work Institute. We've also been chosen as the Best Workplace in Finland four times (2014, 2015, 2016 & 2022). 

Feel free to send us your application either in Finnish or English. 
 
 P.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, we need you to have the necessary permits for working in Finland.

Results.Heading: CX Senior Developer
Results.Descr:
We are now looking for a CX Senior Developer to join our team! We are passionate to deliver real value to the customer, eager to learn and use new technologies and choose the best way to do things based on the customer's needs. You will work with our large customer base and complement our team of service designers, UX artists, order management and B2B process gurus, SAP wizards, integration experts and developers.

Results.Heading: Embedded Software Developer
Results.Descr:
Are embedded software, sensors, backend stuff, and IoT your thing? Whenever you see a new gadget, do you want to open it up and explore it in detail? If yes, we might just have the place for you, as we are currently looking for an experienced Embedded Systems Generalist in the Tampere area.
 
In short, we are seeking a person who can write code for controlling devices and machines and making them operate as you desire. The scale of the projects we offer is wide: from small microcontrollers without operating systems to computers running Linux. Sometimes, if the hardware doesn't work as expected, you might need to grab the oscilloscope and debug the hardware or use a soldering iron to fix it. In terms of technology, the keywords are C / C ++, Qt, Python, Linux, and Robot Framework. 
 
The role requires diverse technical understanding, accuracy, and the ability to produce high-quality code. We hope you don't mind working in close cooperation with our customers as that is how we are used to doing things at Vincit. In this role, familiarity with the mystical abbreviations AWS, GCP, or Azure is an advantage. You don't have to be a cloud platform expert, but if you are interested in learning more about these technologies, that would be great.
 
Why Vincit?
 
Continuous development, agility, and individual freedom have always been essential for us. At Vincit, you get to lead yourself, design your own role, shake up the stuffy traditions of working life, and work in a modern environment that helps people reach their dreams. Depending on the customer projects, you are also able to work remotely. However, embedded projects often revolve around hardware, and that may mean that working on customer premises is the best option. 
 
Click here to learn about the tons of other reasons why Vincit may be a great home away from home for you and how we make sure that our daily work is not just about going through the motions.
 
 Vincit has been awarded as the Best Workplace in Europe by the Great Place to Work Institute. We've also been chosen as the Best Workplace in Finland four times (2014, 2015, 2016 & 2022). 
 
Feel free to send us your application either in Finnish or English.
 
 P.S. Please note that if you live abroad and want to work with us, we need you to have the necessary permits for working in Finland.

Results.Heading: Software Developer in Industrial IoT
Results.Descr:
Are you interested in working with state-of-the-art technologies to build fresh new features to our award-winning product IoT-TICKET®? Look no further!  We're excited to offer a unique chance to jump into the exciting world of Industrial IoT!

We are now searching for two experienced Java/DevOps/Cloud technologies experts to strengthen our IoT-TICKET® Product Development Team.

As an IoT-TICKET® Software Expert, you get to work with new technologies and modern cloud environments. You’ll be part of our experienced IoT-TICKET® Product Development Team, which is responsible for implementing new product features and developing DevOps practices.

We're looking for a software enthusiast who has a good understanding of modern development practices and values software quality and automated testing. With the IoT-TICKET® Product Development Team, you will find a warm work environment, great colleagues, a meaningful job and diverse working tasks where you get to solve meaningful real-world problems and help our customers succeed with the latest technologies and digital solutions. We are sure that in this environment and with our career development paths you will both get to utilize your previous expertise and also develop your skills further.

What we're expecting from you:Experience from one or several of: Java, Azure cloud services, modern CI/CD solutions
Positive attitude for learning new technologies
Fearless attitude for technical problem solving
Good communication skills in English (Finnish is not a must but considered a plus)
Experience from working with microservice architecture, Spring boot, Kubernetes or any modern cloud environment is considered a plus

The job can be done remotely or from any of our sites (Tampere, Vaasa, Helsinki, Turku, Jyväskylä, Seinäjoki, Hyvinkää or Oulu) and of course flexibly remotely in Finland, too.


Why join Wapice?


Wapice is a technology and digitalization partner established in 1999 and employing over 340 people in 10 sites around Finland. We deliver solutions to globally leading industrial companies mainly in the fields of energy technology and moving machinery. We help our customers transform into digital champions for creating a better future. Our competence ranges from electronics design, software development in embedded software and data science up to modern mobile and cloud based software solutions. We also support our customers in future technologies such as 5G, IoT and Artificial Intelligence with our expertise. Currently our own product portfolio consists of three cloud based products which are IoT-TICKET®, Summium® and EcoReaction.

We also invest highly in the well-being of our community and employees. On top of a competitive base salary, meaningful and challenging work and a great culture, we offer our people an extended line of benefits, such as:

A vast occupational healthcare system
A low-hierarchy agile organization, where you can influence in the way you work daily and have an impact in the company's development
Annual sports, culture and wellbeing balance benefit
Work and free-time insurance
Lunch benefit
Sports and fun clubs
Many recreational and community-boosting staff events and of course,

Various ways to develop your professional skills: Mentoring, courses, certifications, technology studies etc
Read more about our culture and working at Wapice at our career site.


Did we catch your interest?


Great! Leave your application through our easy-to-use recruitment platform, and we'll be in touch. We will start interviews already during the application process and the position will be filled as soon as the suitable candidate is found, so be sure to apply right away.

Our HR Business Partner Antti Reijonen (050 410 1151 / antti.reijonen@wapice.com) is happy to answer any questions you might have about our recruitment process or about working at Wapice in general. For more technical questions you can contact our IoT-TICKET Product Manager Jukka Niemi (050 544 9701 / jukka.niemi@wapice.com). We hope to hear from you soon!

Results.Heading: Full Stack developers (interest towards Scala, Elm), Helsinki/Oslo
Results.Descr:
Job ID: 12206

Nordea Finance Equipment is now looking for three software developers to join our development of our front office systems. Systems are web applications and built on a functional programming platform.

We are working in an agile environment with several autonomous where we focus on specific products / web applications – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll find plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger. 

About this opportunity

Welcome to an engaging development team. We work together in teams consisting of developers, designers, business developers and domain specialists. We add value by building web applications for internal working officers and salesmen, suppliers and end users. As software developer you will play a valuable role in creating high-performing, flexible, robust, scalable and easily maintainable systems in Nordea Finance.

What you will be doing: 

Building web applications in the functional languages Scala and Elm.
Working both with frontend and backend as a full stack developer.
Working together with the rest of your multidisciplinary agile product team.
Working closely with the other product teams to reach common goals.

We are building up a team of developers in Helsinki with an aim of close cooperation with the rest of the team located in Oslo. You would be based either in Helsinki or Oslo. Please indicate your preferred location in your CV or motivation letter, and if you have already a valid work permit for this location.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best- and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are collaborative and achieve your expectations through communication and teamwork
Are curious, responsive and can understand the needs of others to ensure delivery of the desired results
See learning from others as a growth opportunity
Work qualitatively and strive to always do things better
Have a high level of self-motivation
 

Your experience and background:

Agile methodologies
Unit testing experience
Programming experience with JVM languages
Basic HTML and CSS
Git

As an advantage, familiarity or interest with some of the below:

Scala
Elm
Cloud technology
Functional programming

What we offer

Our team is responsible of digital applications which are used by Nordea Finance customers. From business point of view we support finance instruments between B2B customers, and our team is responsible of the end-to-end development for end users.

You would have excellent colleagues (in total 5 nationalities) who work in Helsinki and Oslo offices. All of us are software developer professionals who co-operate with other tech stakeholders in an agile way. Scale and impact of our daily work is something you will only discover once you join us! Friendly, helpful colleagues, and interesting business area are things we would like to highlight from our team.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

​Please note that we will start interviews already before job opening closes, submit your application as soon as possible, no later than 11/09/2022.

​For more information, you’re welcome to contact Jarkko Laine jarkko.laine@nordea.com.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Results.Heading: Segment Business Developer
Results.Descr:
WHAT'S THE ROLE

Are you a results driven business developer with, looking for an opportunity to enhance your career & earning potential?
Does the thought of working within a fast paced and varied sector excite you?
If yes to both the above, you could be the superstar we are seeking.
Due to continued growth, we’re currently looking for driven and motivated business developers to join our fast-growing Energy & Industry (E&I) team in Finland.

WHO IS HILTI?

If you’re new to the industry, you might not have heard of us. We provide leading-edge tools, technologies, software and services for the global construction sector. We have a proud heritage, built over 75 years, and a worldwide reputation for pioneering products and exceptional service. With 30,000 people in more than 120 countries, which we’re looking to expand, we’re a great place for you to show us your worth, step up to new challenges and grow your career.

WHAT DOES THE ROLE INVOLVE?

At Hilti, our Energy & Industry commitment is to deliver sustainability with the aim to reduce total cost of ownership for facility owners, EPCs, contractors and OEMs across Natural Resources, Power and Industry business segments. We work across the project lifecycle and build a customized value proposition on engineering, logistic services, special product solutions, site support and price agreements to go hand in hand with the customer’s specific requirements.

As a Business developer predominantly responsible for Industry segment you will be accountable for owning and leading account development plans to drive sales with selected industrial customers across Finland. You will work exceptionally closely with these organizations on their all organizational levels and decision makers to build a pipeline of opportunities and collaborate with Account teams. Working day to day with a close-knit team of Business developers across the region you will start to further develop your knowledge and expertise in a range of segments within Energy & Industry.

You will report directly to E1 Industry Segment Manager.


WHAT DO WE OFFER?

You’ll get into Hilti's excellent corporate culture. With us personal growth, professional growth and company growth go hand in hand. We develop, challenge and encourage our people to develop themselves and provide only the best possible service to our loyal customers.

WHAT YOU NEED IS:

3 years + experience in relevant technical sales or business development role
Experience within the Industrial sector
Good understanding of dynamics in construction and industrial processes
Customer-facing/sales experience gained within an Energy & Industry segment
Mature, assertive attitude and committed to your career development with good communication skills
Resilience and goal orientated, with the ability to overcome barriers
Business sales & negotiation skills
Willingness to travel international and nationally
Driving license
Fluent in Finnish

WHO SHOULD APPLY?

We have an excellent mix of people and some of our best employees joined us with no previous experience from construction industry. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background is. If you are a sales professional or willing to become one, with an interest towards technology, you'll feel at home with Hilti.


Please leave your application for this role no later than the 11th of September 2022
However, this position will be filled when we have found the right person.

Further information on the role can be provided by the Sales Director Antti Rahikkala antti.rahikkala@hilti.com or the Energy Segment Manager Teemu Rissanen, teemu.rissanen@hilti.com ,

The starting date for this position is the beginning of January 2023.

Results.Heading: Senior Project Manager/ Programme Manager
Results.Descr:
Company Description

Handling billions of transactions annually, Nets is among the top payment processors in Europe. We keep a tight focus on making it even easier and more intuitive for our customers to handle digital payments and related services. This has made us a trusted partner to more than 700,000 merchant outlets, including 140,000 online merchant outlets, more than 260,000 enterprises and over 250 banks across Europe.

Changing the future of payments takes strong personalities

At Nets, you'll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Here, it's not just skills and ambition that gets the job done, it's the full package that makes the difference. Together, we secure critical payments infrastructure and explore domains like biometrics, AI and voice assistants. Help us impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business and colleague.

Job Description

Customer Implementation (CI) is a newly established function in Nets Issuer & eSecurity Services established to secure the delivery of strategic customer implementations all over Europe. Several big projects and programs are organized and governed through this organization, and as a Program Manager, you will be heading one of the complex programs, thereby accountable for delivering according to strategic objectives and customer requirements. You demonstrate authority in your communication with customers and management and show great leadership skills toward the project teams within your program. You proactively manage and report on execution of deliverables on high level, but you are also able to dig into the details whenever appropriate.

In this role, you will have the following responsibilities, among others:
Overall accountable for program delivery according to internal and external deadlines and requirements
Leading project teams in a matrix and hybrid delivery model, across business areas and agile delivery teams
Stakeholder management of key people, including senior management from the customer's and Nets organizations
Financial forecasting and reporting to internal and external Program Boards
Ensuring continuous improvements and implementation of lessons within the program and across the Customer Implementation team

As you will be responsible for international customer implementations, you must expect some travelling.

Qualifications

For this job, your vast experience and people skills are critical, but it is also the little twist in your personality that makes a difference at Nets.

Your professional qualifications include
10+ years of project/ programme management experience, either from internal positions or as consultant
3+ years of experience working on executive level projects
Experience from the Payment industry and the Finnish market
Knowledge or certification in working with agile methodologies (SAFe)
Experience leading migration projects e.g. Datacenter, Card portfolio, platform & processor migrations
Strong communication skills
Fluent in English
Fluent in Finnish

Your personal qualifications include high spirits and constant energy and drive. You must adapt well to change and be able to motivate teams to do the same. Furthermore, you must be customer-centric as well as strategically intuitive.

Additional Information

Apply now to power your career

Apply with your CV l and if you want, you can attach a short video clip. 

You can meet more of our personalities by visiting our careers page:

https://www.nets.eu/careers/employees/Pages/default.aspx

We conduct background checks on relevant candidates through our partner Semac, www.semac.no.

Results.Heading: Automation engineer/ System Developer, Embedded and Extended Controls
Results.Descr:
Wärtsilä is leading the maritime industry's transformation towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. We at Wärtsilä Marine Power are proud to offer our customers the world's widest network of maritime expertise and the full portfolio from engines to lifecycle solutions. 
 
 We want to change the course towards an interconnected and cleaner maritime future and are constantly on the lookout for future-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services - together.  Are you ready to jump onboard? 

Wärtsilä Marine Power Solutions RDE, Automation & Controls is looking for Automation engineers, Embedded Controls. Our industry is entering a new era of innovation and unprecedented efficiency where Wartsila will bring value to all Marine and Energy applications worldwide by innovative use of new fuels and new control strategies. We are participating in sustainable society creation by building power and energy management control systems for future generations. Our vision is to exceed customer expectations by providing best in class engine control systems for superior engine performance and functionality. 
 
 We are now looking for Automation engineers, embedded controls who gets exited in developing control systems. We develop and maintain embedded engine control systems for all Wartsila engines using simulated and real targets. Join our team of talented professionals in Automation & Control by applying now. 

Location for this position is Vaasa or Turku, Finland. We offer also possibilities for partial remote work. 

 What we offer  

- Freedom and responsibility over your work enabling excellent work/life -balance 
 - Being part of experienced and diverse self-driving cross functional teams 
 - Possibility to work in an organisation applying industry best practises in daily way of working 
 - Researching and developing industrial embedded control systems 
 - Develop your skills in control system and software development combined with good career development opportunities 
 - Possibility to work in the state-of-the art R&D environment in the new Smart Technology Hub Wartsila (  https://www.wartsila.com/sth  )  

 Your typical day will include  

- Design and implementation of new functionality to our engine control systems with C/C++ or Matlab/Simulink e.g. fuel injection control, charge air pressure control, combustion control, communication protocols etc. 
 - Design, implementation, testing and verification of new features 
 - Validating control functionalities in simulated and production engines 
 - Maintenance and troubleshooting issues in production systems 

 Required Skills  

- Master or Bachelor degree in Automation, Process engineering, Computer Science or similar 
 - Functionality development and simulation skills using Matlab/Simulink or C/C++ development skills preferably for embedded systems. 
 - Knowledge in agile development practises DevOps, especially continuous integration, automated testing and continuous delivery is a plus 
 - Good teamworking and communication skills are essential 
 - Fluency in verbal and written English, our everyday work language is mainly English 
 - Experience with the following seen as an advantage: Atlassian toolset & Git 
 - Skills in data science and/or Python is a plus 

Please apply by 11th of September, 2022 

For more information, please contact 
 
 Markus Mesimäki 
 
 General Manager, Automation System Lifecycle 
 
 markus.mesimaki@wartsila.com 

All new Wärtsilä employees in Finland will attend occupational health check, including the drug test/screening. The legislation of the country followed when person is located outside of Finland.
 At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job-relevant merits and abilities. 

This is Wärtsilä 
 
 Wärtsilä Marine Power leads the industry in its journey towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. Our broad portfolio of engines, propulsion systems, hybrid technology, and integrated powertrain systems delivers the efficiency, reliability, safety, and environmental performance needed to support our customers to be successful. Our offering includes performance-based agreements, lifecycle solutions, and an unrivalled global network of maritime expertise. www.wartsila.com/marine 
 
 Wärtsilä is a global leader in innovative technologies and lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. We emphasise innovation in sustainable technology and services to help our customers continuously improve their environmental and economic performance. Our dedicated and passionate team of 17,000 professionals in more than 200 locations in 68 countries shape the decarbonisation transformation of our industries across the globe. In 2021, Wärtsilä's net sales totalled EUR 4.8 billion. Wärtsilä is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. Find out more at www.wartsila.com.

Results.Heading: Software Developer (Senior)
Results.Descr:
Wärtsilä is leading the maritime industry's transformation towards a decarbonised and sustainable future. We at Wärtsilä Marine Power are proud to offer our customers the world's widest network of maritime expertise and the full portfolio from engines to lifecycle solutions. 
 
 We want to change the course towards an interconnected and cleaner maritime future and are constantly on the lookout for future-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services - together. Are you ready to jump onboard? 

Digital Product Development (DPD) are looking for an experienced Software developer with an affinity for big data, data platforms and microservices. Your work contributes to ensure high quality, high volume and high-frequency data availability as the backbone for our digital products. 

You will join a team of six experienced developers located in Finland and the Netherlands. The team consists of backend, full-stack, DevOps & test automation focussed people with a fine sense of humour! 

What are your main tasks and responsibilities?   You enjoy creating efficient solutions that are scalable over hundreds of installations. 
 You are a key part of the development and maintenance of our streaming data platform, pipelines, databases and APIs. 
 You align implementation efforts with other developers across multiple development teams. 
 You participate in the setup of monitoring for data pipeline status and data quality. 
 You are a team player and embrace opportunities to help the team and product to grow. 
 You enjoy learning new things and aren't afraid to experiment. 
What do we expect from you?   You have a Bachelor or Master's degree in Computer Science or at least 3 years of relevant experience. 
 Experience with: 
 Kafka clusters, -streams, -connectors, ksqlDB and Kafka as a messaging and storage solution. 
 Java (Spring). 
 AWS services. 
 Kubernetes and Docker. 
 Timeseries and noSQL databases. 
 Automated testing and test driven development. 
 Experience with Python and/or Terraform is a plus. 
 Experience with serverless concepts such as AWS lambda is a plus. 
 About DPD 

DPD develops digital products for both Marine and Energy businesses, we utilise a common technology stack to generate insight from operational data, to make for example predictive maintenance- or efficiency optimisation products such as Wärtsilä Expert Insight. 

DPD consists of around 110 people, 11 self-managing development teams and three support teams. 

We operate with a scaled approach to agile development; we work with one backlog of prioritised high-level epics for all self-managing teams. The teams are in close contact with stakeholders, take time to learn and are empowered to arrange their work content in collaboration with the product owner to ensure we can focus on delivering the most value to the product. Scrum masters support the adoption and work with teams to develop practices to sustain an impactful and enjoyable way of working. 

By adopting a progressive way of working we aim to further our position as a trusted partner for Wärtsilä business and offer a fulfilling workplace for our people. We want to deepen our understanding of our business and take an active approach to personal growth, providing opportunities for people to further develop skills and knowledge with support from our people managers.
 At Wärtsilä we take a hybrid approach to location, we aim to be together one day per week in our sites with a focus on collaborative work, enjoying each other's company and re-enforcing our sense of purpose. 
 
 Our sites are in Helsinki, Vaasa, Turku in Finland and Drunen in the Netherlands, however we will also consider applications from other locations. 

 Why Wärtsilä? 

We believe in empowerment, ownership and taking responsibility of our work. We support each other's growth and co-creation is the true basis of our innovation. We have courage to see opportunities and take initiative. 
 We are authentic and honest, and we strongly believe in a diverse and inclusive work community where everyone can be their true self. We don't always get it right the first time, and if mistakes are made, we make sure to learn and grow from them. We want everyone to voice their opinions freely. That is why we have built an environment that empowers you and everyone around you, and where you can feel safe and cared for. Are you eager to be part of this ambition? 

You will be a part of a global organization with local presence and work in an exciting and dynamic working environment with highly motivated and skilled co-workers. We offer interesting and challenging work tasks, as well as personal and professional development in a great team. 

Please apply by 11th of September 2022 
 
 For more information, please contact:
 Mark Dagnall, Scrum Master
 mark.dagnall@wartsila.com 

Last application date: 11/09/2022 
 
 At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job-relevant merits and abilities. 

This is Wärtsilä 
 
 Wärtsilä is a global leader in innovative technologies and lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. We emphasise innovation in sustainable technology and services to help our customers continuously improve their environmental and economic performance. Our dedicated and passionate team of 17,000 professionals in more than 200 locations in 68 countries shape the decarbonisation transformation of our industries across the globe. In 2021, Wärtsilä's net sales totalled EUR 4.8 billion. Wärtsilä is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. Find out more at www.wartsila.com.

Results.Heading: Ohjelmistosuunnittelija / Programmer
Results.Descr:
AILiveSim is a young startup that uses gaming technology to create realistic dynamic simulation for training and testing AI algorithms. Our software can be used to augment datasets, collect associated ground truth, train new learning algorithms using curriculum, or various types of testing. We create environments that look realistic, are parametric and we model some procedural elements to allow for a maximum of variations. 

You are passionate about game technology, XR or simulation, and are looking to sharpen your skills with industry application. You might not have tons of experience, but you have worked on personal projects and have a strong will to learn and to succeed. 

Your responsibility is to design and implement parts of our system and to guide the content team. 
 
 We expect successful candidates to have the following : 
 - experience with programming game play, graphics, animations or other subsystems or tools for game or simulation
 - know about games or real time 3D simulation 
 - familiar with unreal engine 
 - c/c++, python 
 
 We see some of the following as valuable assets for your success:
 - game development, experience in a 3D game
 - computer graphics 
 - test driven development 
 - neural networks 
 - embedded robotics software 
 - back-end / full stack 
 
 The work is remote and very flexible. We can customize your working hours based on your expectations. We offer a motivating compensation plan, a large amount of freedom in your work and an unmatched human adventure. You will get a chance to play a key role in the life of our growing company. We are currently looking for exceptional candidates, self-driven and highly motivated. Because we use game technologies, our work has a lot in common with game development, and we value prior experience in game projects. We value experience and education but we also know that talent doesn't necessarily come with the number of years. We also believe in the power of the team, so a team player that is able to communicate and brainstorm is considered a must.

 WWW-osoite  http://www.ailivesim.com
Yhteystiedot  Jerome Leudet, Puh: +358 44 269 9309, jerome@ailivesim.com
 Työpaikan osoite  00350 HELSINKI
 Työ alkaa  asap
 Työaika kokoaikatyö
 Työn kesto yli 12 kuukautta
 Ilmoitus jätetty  25.08.2022
 Ilmoitusnumero  11583365

Results.Heading: AutoCAD-ohjelmoija
Results.Descr:
Etsimme asiakasyrityksellemme Pelaser Oy:lle lasertyöstökoneen AutoCAD-ohjelmoijaa kokoaikaiseen ja vakituiseen työsuhteeseen Kuorttiin. Töiden aloitus on mahdollisimman pian sopimuksen mukaan. Työ tapahtuu pääsääntöisesti paikan päällä. Haastattelemme hakijoita jo hakuaikana ja teemme valinnat heti, kun sopiva ehdokas on löytynyt.

Tehtävän kuvaus

Tehtävänäsi on piirtää ja käsitellä asiakkaan lähettämiä piirrustuksia, joiden pohjalta teet ohjelman laseria varten. 

Odotamme sinulta

Toivomme sinulta aiempaa kokemusta AutoCAD-ohjelmoinnista. Osaat lukea piirrustuksia sekä sinulla on tarvittaessa kykyä tehdä piirrustuksia myös itse. Olet tarkka ja huolellinen työssäsi. Tehtävä edellyttää hyvää suomen kielen kirjallista ja suullista osaamista.

Tarjoamme sinulle
Tarjoamme sinulle vastuullisen työtehtävän kasvavassa ja kehittyvässä perheyrityksessä, kattavan perehdytyksen työhösi sekä laadukkaat ja siistit työtilat. Saat vakituisen työn osana mukavaa työtiimiä.
Kiinnostuitko?

Lisätietoja tehtävästä ja hakuprosessista antaa Eilakaislan henkilöstökonsultti Ella Saijanen, +358 50 401 5587 / ella.saijanen@eilakaisla.fi

Lähetä hakemuksesi ansioluetteloineen ja palkkatoivomuksineen viimeistään 11.9.2022.

Työsuhteen tyyppi: Toistaiseksi voimassa oleva, kokoaikainen

Results.Heading: Java sovelluskehittäjä
Results.Descr:
Haluaisitko olla osana tiimiä, joka varmistaa, että liiketoimintakriittiset palvelumme Suomessa pysyvät toiminnassa? Me Ifillä haluamme tarjota asiakkaillemme mukavuutta, helppoutta ja luottamusta olla utelias, tutkia uusia maailmoja, perustaa uusia yrityksiä ja elää elämäänsä. Haluamme tarjota parhaita tuotteita ja sovelluskehittäjillämme on tässä keskeinen rooli varmistamassa, että asiakkaidemme vakuutuksia hallinnoidaan parhaalla mahdollisella tavalla.

Mitä pääsisit meillä tekemään?

Yhdessä tiimisi kanssa ylläpidätte ja kehitätte sovelluksia yksityisasiakasliiketoiminta-alueella Suomessa. Meillä on satoja tuhansia asiakkaita ja kehittämillämme sovelluksilla on suuri vaikutus siihen, että pystymme tarjoamaan parasta mahdollista palvelua kaikille heille! Suurin osa tiimimme vastuulla olevista järjestelmistä perustuu keskuskoneratkaisuihin, mutta lisäksi meillä on Java sovelluksia, joilla on suuri merkitys liiketoiminnallemme Suomessa. Tässä roolissa et näe pelkästään vain pientä osaa alasta vaan tulet näkemään miten vakuutukset toimivat käytännössä. Etsimme ensisijaisesti sovelluskehittäjää, mutta mikäli olet kiinnostunut päivittämään tai ylläpitämään työkalujamme ja sovellusalustoihin liittyviä teknologioita niiden eliniän pidentämiseksi, meillä on myös mahdollisuuksia näillä osa-alueilla.

Millainen meidän tiimimme on?

Toimit sovelluskehitysyksikössä, jonka vastuulla on maakohtaiset sovellukset. Tiimi on Suomessa, suurimmaksi osaksi Turussa ja Espoossa. Tiimissämme on pitkiä työsuhteita ja paljon kokemusta Ifin ja Sammon sovellusratkaisuista, joten mihinkään kysymykseesi sovellusalueesta ei jätetä vastaamatta. Etsimme kollegaa, joka työskentelee organisoidusti, ratkaisukeskeisesti ja on innostunut sekä uusista että myöskin perinteisistä teknologioista.

Odotamme sinulta:

Odotamme muutaman vuoden kokemusta Java kehityksestä sekä suomen ja englannin kielitaitoa. Omaat Agilen ajattelutavan sekä muutamat näistä teknologioista ovat sinulle tuttuja: Quarkus, Vaadin, Docker, Kubernetes ja Azure Pipelines.

Käytämme tällä hetkellä kehitystyökaluja ja teknologioita, kuten Eclipse, Jenkins, Maven, XL Deploy, Azure GIT. Katsomme myös näiden tuntemuksen eduksi.

Lisätietoa:

Hakuaikaa on 11.9.2022 asti. Lisääthän ystävällisesti CV:si ja hakemuskirjeesi Hae työpaikkaa-painikkeen kautta, kun haet paikkaa. Huomioithan, ettemme käsittele sähköpostitse tulleita hakemuksia. Toimipisteenäsi voi toimia Kupittaa Turussa tai Espoon Keilaniemi. Työtehtävä vaatii jonkin verran matkustamista Pohjoismaissa. Aloituspäivämäärä on sovittavissa.

Kysyttävää?

Mikäli sinulla on kysyttävää työtehtävästä, olethan matalalla kynnyksellä yhteyksissä Raimo Valtoseen (raimo.valtonen@if.fi) tai Kimmo Leppäseen (kimmo.leppanen@if.fi)

Tervetuloa Ifiin!

Results.Heading: Cloud Developer (Python)
Results.Descr:
F-Secure delivers research-led cyber security to defend organizations, society and people from real-world attacks and build resilience into their approach. Our people are a mix of technical and creative experts – diverse, talented, and passionate people – working tirelessly to help us advance the industry with new ways of thinking. They lead their own development, in and out of the office. They call the shots when it comes to building a place to call home in our organization.

Would you like to apply your development skills in an growing company with a tangible impact in consumer cyber security? As our Cloud Developer with a focus on Python, you will be working with the core cloud services powering F-Secure's world-class cyber security product and services. Our systems are widely utilizing AWS services and are developed with DevOps/SRE mindset, CI/CD, self-healing, elasticity and all that jazz. It's not often you get to work with scale like this, building backend systems that need scale with tens of millions end customers, with wide range of different clients deployed in the wild.

Key responsibilities :

Design & develop scalable microservices running on AWS infrastructure, end-to-end fashion include CI/CD pipeline and production monitoring
Provide expert-level technical support to other functions
Liaison with other development teams and functions to build and provide best fit-for-purpose service


What are we looking for?

AWS services
API Development experience
Solid work experience with Python
Experience or willingness to learn NodeJS and Java


Bonus points:

Cross-team communication skills with solution oriented thinking
Having eye on the end-deliverable, not only your own territory
Agile, DevOps experience
IAM Domain knowledge
Scaling up services on a scale of 10-100s of millions of clients
Note: if you are not into Python but still crave to join us with Java or Identity & Access Management (IAM) angle, you should send application anyway! We have several positions open for cloud developers with a Python, Java or IAM focus.

What will you get from us:

Work with a purpose - contribute to protection of digital moments of consumers
Flexible and friendly working environment surrounded by world-class software and cyber security experts
Ability to influence team practices and culture as one of the core members of the team
A competitive benefits package
Our benefits include extensive health care, remote working, company supported sport activities, lunch vouchers, regular massages, gym and sauna at the premises and many more things to keep our best asset – people - happy!

See yourself here? Bring your best self and apply now with your CV and application with a salary request.

A security background check will possibly be conducted for the selected candidate in accordance with Finnish Security Clearance act 726/2015

Results.Descr:

Results.Heading: Junior verkko/C/Python kehittäjä
Results.Descr:
Haemme Tampereelle Sarankulman kampuksellemme tai Espooseen verkko/C/Python kehittäjää oman tuotteemme kehitystiimiin. 

Pääset mukaan Insta Safelink VPN -tuoteperheen kehitykseen yhdessä asiantuntevan tiimin kanssa. Insta SafeLink on TLIII-hyväksytty VPN-ratkaisu (Virtual Private Network) turvakriittisten organisaatioiden yksiköiden ja toimipisteiden välisen tietoliikenteen vahvaan suojaamiseen. Tyypillisiä ratkaisun käyttäjiä ovat esimerkiksi puolustushallinto ja muut viranomaiset sekä yritykset, joilla on turvakriittisiä tietoliikenneyhteyksiä.

Mitä pääset tekemään?

Pääset mukaan ketterästi työskentelevään tuotekehitystiimiimme. Ohjelmistokehittäjänä työskentelet C- ja Python-kielillä, sekä sukellat myös reitittimien, palomuurien ja halutessasi raudan pariin. Tehtävässä saat nauttia vahvasta, pitkäjänteisestä asiantuntijaroolista sekä haastavasta ja koko ajan uudistuvasta kehitystyöstä. Kiireen ja hoppuilun sijaan panostamme laatuun ja huolellisuuteen. Työskentelemme Scrum-pohjaisesti, joten jokaisella on mahdollisuus vaikuttaa niin tuotteeseen kuin tekemiinsä työtehtäviin. Rooli ja haasteet muokkautuvat sinun näköiseksesi. Tehtävästä on myös hyvät etenemismahdollisuudet kyberturvallisuuden asiantuntijatehtäviin.

Työssäsi onnistumalla pääset vaikuttamaan myös merkittävästi yhteiskuntaan, ja sen turvallisuuteen sekä näkemään oman kädenjälkesi lopputuotteessa. Ohjelmistokehityksen ohessa pääset sisälle kyberturvallisuuden ytimeen ja verkkoteknologioiden maailmaan.

Mitä toivomme sinulta?

Teemme työtä vahvasti tiiminä, joten toivoisimme, että sinäkin nauttisit muiden kanssa työskentelystä. Lisäksi työssä menestyäksesi sinun on huomioitava kyberturvallisuus päivittäisessä tekemisessäsi.

Tärkeintä roolin kannalta olisi verkkoteknologioiden aiempi tuntemus, sillä sitä puolta on vaikeampi oppia työtä tehdessä.

Lisäksi olisi hyvä taitaa:

C ja Python
Linux
Git
Suomen kielen sujuva kirjallinen ja suullinen taito



Keitä me olemme?

Teemme töitä aidosti yhdessä tiimin kesken. Kaikki haluavat kehittyä, katselmoimme toistemme koodia, ja kysymme sekä annamme palautetta toisillemme. Innostumme muutenkin uuden oppimisesta ja opitun jakamisesta, ja vaalimme rentoa ilmapiiriä. Avoimessa kulttuurissamme voitkin kysyä mitä vain, mistä vain, keneltä tahansa ja saada aina vastauksen.

Tällä hetkellä työskentelemme hybridimallilla. Oli työpisteesi sitten mökillä tai toimistolla, päivittäisillä virtuaalikahveilla jutellaan kaikkea maan ja taivaan väliltä. Jatkossa joustava etätyö on halutessasi mahdollista, mutta näemme mielellämme toisiamme myös toimistolla.

Suomalaisena perheyhtiönä mottomme "Lupa luottaa" konkretisoituu jokapäiväisessä työssämme: toimimme asiakaslähtöisesti ja kannamme yhdessä vastuun tiimin ja jokaisen instalaisen hyvinvoinnista. Maksamme myös osaamistasi vastaavan kilpailukykyisen palkan muine etuineen. Kattavaan etupakettiimme kuuluu esimerkiksi liikunnan ja kulttuurin lisäksi hieronta- ja joukkoliikenne-etu, laaja vapaa-ajan tapaturmavakuutus ja työsuhdepyörä. Tampereella Sarankulmassa voit mm. kuntoilla omalla kuntosalillamme ja ladata henkilökunnan omilla pisteillä niin sähköpyörän kuin autonkin. Sarankulmasta löytyy myös oma työterveyshuollon toimipisteemme. Espoossa toimistollemme Keilaniemeen on helppo tulla esimerkiksi metrolla ja käydä kuntosalilla vaikka kesken työpäivän. Työn- ja vapaa-ajan yhteensovittaminen sujuu meillä vaivatta joustavien työaikojen ja perhemyönteisen kulttuurin ansiosta. Meillä voidaan hyvin ja viihdytään pitkään! Lue lisää meistä Instalaisista täältä.

Odotamme jo hakemustasi!

Kasvamme suomalaisena perheyhtiönä vakaasti, ja käymme jatkuvasti keskusteluja uusien osaajien kanssa. Haet tehtävää helposti joko LinkedIn-profiililla tai jättämällä CV:si meille. Käsittelemme hakemuksesi kahden viikon sisällä, ja olemme yhteydessä jokaiseen hakijaan. Teemme rekrypäätöksen aina heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä. Riku Kajasilta, 0442590966 keskustelee mielellään kanssasi tehtävästä ja vastaa kysymyksiin. Mikäli sinulla on kysyttävää rekrytointiprosessiin liittyen, voit olla yhteydessä Instan rekrytointiin, rekry(at)insta.fi. Haku päättyy 13.9., mutta käymme hakemuksia läpi jo hakuaikana. 

Meille työsuhteeseen tuleville tehdään perusmuotoinen henkilöturvallisuusselvitys ja huumausainetesti ennen työsuhteen alkamista.

﻿Insta on luotettu, vahvojen arvojen suomalainen perheyritys ja kumppani älykkään teollisuuden, puolustuksen, ja kyberturvallisuuden asiakkailleen. Yhdistämällä huippuosaaminen ja älykäs teknologia kehitämme asiakkaidemme suorituskykyä ja tuloksellisuutta yhä nopeammin muuttuvassa digitalisoituvassa maailmassa. Ihmiset, osaaminen ja vastuullisuus ovat toimintakulttuurimme perusta. Meihin on lupa luottaa.﻿

Results.Heading: Junior Embedded Software Developer, ABB, Helsinki
Results.Descr:
We are now looking for a Junior Embedded Software Developer to work at our client company ABB. If you know your way at C++ and want to learn more about developing embedded systems, this might be the job for you! Read more and apply already today - we will fill the position as soon as we find the right person

About the role

ABB Drives is now looking for a Junior Embedded Software Developer who wants to gain experience at the field and is willing to learn more and grow as a professional with embedded systems. You will be working in development team within General Purpose and Segment Drives Product Unit. At first you will focus on developing existing software and help e.g. with troubleshooting bugs. You will start with easier tasks and more experienced colleagues will be there to support you. With time, you will have great possibility to get more tasks and responsibility. We are looking someone who enjoys learning and wants to take this position as a possibility to grow as an expert.

You are offered
Possibility to gain experience with embedded systems
Support of an experienced team
Possibility to work in well-known global company


As a consultant at Academic Work you are offered a great opportunity to grow as a professional, extend your network and establish valuable contacts for the future.

Job duties

At first your main duty is to develop and maintain existing software and help to resolve problems that there might be. After gaining experience you will get more responsibility and more challenging tasks to work with, for example with new software.

We are looking for

Suitable educational background (E.g. Computer science or information engineering)
Good knowledge in C++
Fluency in both written and spoken English (Finnish is a plus)


Knowledge in Python is seen as an advantage.

As a person you are co-operative, willing to learn and develop yourself, and you enjoy working in a multicultural environment.

Other information
Start: As soon as possible
Work extent: Permanent
Location: Helsinki, Pitäjänmäki (you will have a chance to work remotely 2 days a week)


This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client's wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.

Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase

Client information

ABB is a pioneering technology leader in electrification products, robotics and motion, industrial automation and power grids, serving customers in utilities, industry and transport & infrastructure globally.

Käytämme tällä hetkellä kehitystyökaluja ja teknologioita, kuten Eclipse, Jenkins, Maven, XL Deploy, Azure GIT. Katsomme myös näiden tuntemuksen eduksi.

Lisätietoa:

Hakuaikaa on 11.9.2022 asti. Lisääthän ystävällisesti CV:si ja hakemuskirjeesi, kun haet paikkaa. Huomioithan, ettemme käsittele sähköpostitse tulleita hakemuksia. Toimipisteenäsi voi toimia Kupittaa Turussa tai Espoon Keilaniemi. Työtehtävä vaatii jonkin verran matkustamista Pohjoismaissa. Aloituspäivämäärä on sovittavissa.

Kysyttävää?

Mikäli sinulla on kysyttävää työtehtävästä, olethan matalalla kynnyksellä yhteyksissä Raimo Valtoseen (raimo.valtonen@if.fi) tai Kimmo Leppäseen (kimmo.leppanen@if.fi)

Tervetuloa Ifiin!

Results.Heading: Jr. Developer, Apix tuotekehitys
Results.Descr:
Accountor is one of the leading software technology and R&D companies in Finland. We focus on delivering the best software and the digital experience to help our customers be masters of their everyday business. In this position you would be working as a part of Accountor Group's FMS (financial management software) cluster, in our Apix Product Team. For more information of our product portfolio, please visit our websites: Apix, Procountor, Ecom, Isolta, eTasku. 
 
 (Jr.) Developer
 
 In this position you will be developing our Apix's products. Apix delivers quick, easy, and affordable implementations of e-invoicing - but there is always room to improve! You do not need to be familiar with e-invoicing or the finance segment, but you need to have enthusiasm to learn and to develop our solutions.
 
 We have a team of 8 professionals to support your growth as a developer. When working with us, you are able to participate in various projects, where you are part of designing, developing and testing our solutions. We work with an adapted Agile methodology and we have a hybrid working model, where you can work both from home or our office in Keilaniemi.
 
 With these strengths you are one step ahead:
 
 We are looking for a Developer with a solution-oriented mindset and ability to solve (or at least start solving) problems independently. Finding new information and learning new skills is essential and you get exited about it. You also are keen to develop yourself as a professional. With us, you will have the possibility to grow and challenge yourself! What we are also looking for:
 
 - A degree in software development or equivalent
 - Skills and experience in some widely used coding languages - tell us more about yourself in your cover letter!
 - Relevant job experience from traineeships or summer jobs
 - Other relevant job experience is seen as a big plus, but willingness to learn is an even bigger one
 - Fluency in English both oral and written
 
 Why join us:
 
 - We offer you opportunities for professional growth and to path to develop yourself
 - You will be a part of a modern software development culture with openness to learn and possibility to experiment different ways of working
 - We have great professionals: a truly international group of professionals making top-quality software as a team
 - We offer a substantial set of benefits - a competitive salary and a bonus program, yearly budget for professional development, extensive occupational health services, lunch and recreational benefits
 
 Take advantage of this opportunity and join our team to make a difference!
 
 We look forward to hearing from you and your skills, so please provide your application 11.9.2022. Please notice that we are actively following the process and might proceed to action also during the application period. If you have any recruitment related questions, please do not hesitate to contact us at talent.fms@accountor.fi. Please note that we only accept applications through our recruitment portal and not via email.
 
 About the company
 
 Accountor Group (www.accountor.com) specialises in software solutions and outsourcing services for financial and HR services. The group employs about 2 300 experts in six countries. Our mission is to help our customers use the possibilities of modern technology and digitalization in their everyday work. The group's headquarters is in Espoo, Finland. In addition to Finland, we operate in Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Netherlands, and Ukraine. The turnover of the Accountor Group was 238 M€ in 2021.
 
 You can read more about our supportive, trusting, and friendly atmosphere here on our social media pages or behind #accountorteam.

Yhteystiedot  talent.fms@accountor.fi
